title: How to Obtain a Copy of Your Birth Certificate in Delaware

steps.headline: Gather the proper documentation.
steps.description: In order to get a copy of your Delaware birth certificate in person, you need to make sure you have the proper documentation ready before you visit one of the Offices of Vital Statistics. Having this information ready will ensure that there aren't any delays in getting you the birth certificate. You need to have a completed application form for a certified copy of a Delaware birth certificate. If you are applying for a copy of your own birth certificate, you need to provide a copy of your official photo ID. For example, you can provide your driver's license, military ID, passport, or a work ID. If you are applying for a copy of a birth certificate for another person, you need identification and usually other legal documentation. If you are the person's legal guardian, you require a court order; if you are the authorized agent, legal representative, you must provide some sort of proof of your relationship to the individual; if you are a family member and want it for genealogical purposes, then you also must provide some sort of proof of your relationship to the person. If you want a copy of your child's birth certificate, you will also need proof of this.

steps.headline: Fill out the application form.
steps.description: In addition to your documentation, you need to submit the “application for a certified copy of a Delaware birth certificate.” For the application to be complete, you must fill it out to the best of your knowledge and sign it. The application is available online at http://dhss.delaware.gov/dph/ss/files/birth.pdf. If you have any questions on the application, you can call one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics at the following numbers: Dover, (302) 744-4549; Newark (302) 283-7130; Georgetown (302) 856-5495.

steps.headline: Have payment ready.
steps.description: There is a fee of $25.00 for copies of birth certificates. You must pay this by personal check or money order when you file your application. The Office of Vital Statistics does not take cash or credit cards for the application. If you cannot get a check or money order, you can pay by credit card using the services of VitalChek, which is available online and by telephone. Make the personal check or money order out to Office of Vital Statistics.

methods.name: Getting a Birth Certificate in Person

steps.headline: Determine where to file your application.
steps.description: There are three locations of the Office of Vital Statistics in Delaware where you can file your application for a birth certificate in person. Determine which one is closest to you to get your birth certificate most quickly. There are three locations so that you can choose one closest to you. The three offices are located at: Jesse S. Cooper Building, 417 Federal Street, Dover, DE 19901; Chopin Building, 258 Chapman Road, Newark DE 19702; Thurman Adams State Service Center, 546 South Bedford Street, Georgetown, DE 19947.

steps.headline: File your application at the local Office of Vital Statistics.
steps.description: Once you've determined the closest Office of Vital Statistics to you, take your documentation and payment and file the application. All three offices are open Monday-Friday from 8:00am to 4:15pm, except state and federal holidays.

steps.headline: Wait for the copy of the birth certificate.
steps.description: It can take a few days to a few weeks to get the copy of the birth certificate for which you applied. If you have any questions about the process, you can contact one of the Offices of Vital Statistics at the phone numbers listed above.

methods.name: Getting a Birth Certificate by Mail

steps.headline: Compose a written request for a birth certificate.
steps.description: Because you aren't applying for a birth certificate copy in person, you must compose a letter to the Office of Vital Statistics requesting the birth certificate. All you need simple letter stating that you're applying for the copy of a birth certificate. Make sure to include all of the relevant information in your letter including the date, the name of the person for whom you are requesting a birth certificate, what proof you have of your relationship to the individual if necessary, the address to which the Office of Vital Statistics can send the certified birth certificate copy, and your signature.

steps.headline: Fill out the application form.
steps.description: In addition to your documentation and letter requesting the copy, you need to submit the “application for a certified copy of a Delaware birth certificate.” For the application to be complete, you must fill it out to the best of your knowledge and sign it. The application is available online at http://dhss.delaware.gov/dph/ss/files/birth.pdf.

steps.headline: Send your application to the Office of Vital Statistics.
steps.description: Once you've collected all of your required documentation, send your application to one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics. Send your application to one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics at the following addresses: Jesse S. Cooper Building, 417 Federal Street, Dover, DE 19901; Chopin Building, 258 Chapman Road, Newark DE 19702; Thurman Adams State Service Center, 546 South Bedford Street, Georgetown, DE 19947. Consider sending the application materials by registered mail so that you can ensure that it arrives at the Office of Vital Statistics.

steps.headline: Wait for the copy of the birth certificate.
steps.description: It can take a few days to a few weeks to get the copy of the birth certificate for which you applied by mail. If you have any questions about your application, follow up with of the Offices of Vital Statistics at the phone numbers listed above.

steps.headline: Prepare your documentation.
steps.description: If you're planning to use the online service provided by the State of Delaware to apply for a birth certificate copy, which is called Vitalcheck, have all of your documentation available as you fill out the online forms. This will ensure there are no delays in getting your copies. Have copies of your social security card or number and a photo ID. If you are applying for a birth certificate for someone other than yourself, make sure you have proof of your relationship to that person. Vitalchek accepts credit cards as a form of payment for their services and for the application fees. You can pay with Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover.

steps.headline: Access the VitalCheck website to complete your request.
steps.description: In order to apply for a birth certificate copy online, access the VitalChek website to begin and complete your application. The service has the advantage that you can use it any time you're ready. VitalChek's website for Delaware birth certificates is https://www.vitalchek.com/birth-certificates/delaware/delaware-vital-records-georgetown. You can file your application 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.

steps.headline: Follow online application prompts.
steps.description: The VitalChek website will ask you questions about your application for birth certificate copies. Follow these questions and any prompts for additional information or documentation until your application is complete and you receive a confirmation email. If you have any questions about the process, you can access VitalChek's online FAQ page at https://vitalchek-solutions.custhelp.com/app/home or call their hotline at 1-877-888-0248.

steps.headline: Pay for your birth certificate copies and Vital Chek's service fees.
steps.description: At the end of filing your request online, the Vital Chek website will request your payment. Vital Chek charges not only for the copy of the birth certificate, but also for its expedited services. Vital Chek accepts Visa, Mastercard, Discover, and American Express. The fee for Vital Chek's services ranges from $5 to $16 for obtaining the birth certificate. In addition, Vital Chek will charge you an additional fee for whatever shipping method you choose. The price for that will also vary depending on how quickly you want the birth certificate copy.

steps.headline: Note your confirmation number and wait for your birth certificate copy.
steps.description: After you've filed your application with Vital Chek and paid the relevant fees, you will receive a confirmation number by email. You should receive your birth certificate relatively quickly by using the online service. Make sure to note the confirmation number for the requested birth certificate in order to check up on the status or ask questions you may have. Vital Chek offers fast turnaround on birth certificate requests. The will file your application within one business day to government office and you should expect your copy in about a week. You can also check on the status of your application at https://www.vitalchek.com/order_status_signon.aspx with the order and pin numbers that Vital Chek provide you.

If you have any questions about the process, you can contact one of the Offices of Vital Statistics at the phone numbers listed above. Cooper Building, 417 Federal Street, Dover, DE 19901; Chopin Building, 258 Chapman Road, Newark DE 19702; Thurman Adams State Service Center, 546 South Bedford Street, Georgetown, DE 19947. If you have any questions about the process, you can access VitalChek's online FAQ page at https://vitalchek-solutions.custhelp.com/app/home or call their hotline at 1-877-888-0248. The price for that will also vary depending on how quickly you want the birth certificate copy. Note your confirmation number and wait for your birth certificate copy. After you've filed your application with Vital Chek and paid the relevant fees, you will receive a confirmation number by email. You should receive your birth certificate relatively quickly by using the online service. Make sure to note the confirmation number for the requested birth certificate in order to check up on the status or ask questions you may have. Vital Chek offers fast turnaround on birth certificate requests. The will file your application within one business day to government office and you should expect your copy in about a week. You can also check on the status of your application at https://www.vitalchek.com/order_status_signon.aspx with the order and pin numbers that Vital Chek provide you.

In order to get a copy of your Delaware birth certificate in person, you need to make sure you have the proper documentation ready before you visit one of the Offices of Vital Statistics.
Having this information ready will ensure that there aren't any delays in getting you the birth certificate.
You need to have a completed application form for a certified copy of a Delaware birth certificate.
If you are applying for a copy of your own birth certificate, you need to provide a copy of your official photo ID.
For example, you can provide your driver's license, military ID, passport, or a work ID.
If you are applying for a copy of a birth certificate for another person, you need identification and usually other legal documentation.

If you are the person's legal guardian, you require a court order; if you are the authorized agent, legal representative, you must provide some sort of proof of your relationship to the individual; if you are a family member and want it for genealogical purposes, then you also must provide some sort of proof of your relationship to the person.
If you want a copy of your child's birth certificate, you will also need proof of this.
Fill out the application form.

In addition to your documentation, you need to submit the “application for a certified copy of a Delaware birth certificate.” For the application to be complete, you must fill it out to the best of your knowledge and sign it.
The application is available online at http://dhss.delaware.gov/dph/ss/files/birth.pdf.

If you have any questions on the application, you can call one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics at the following numbers: Dover, (302) 744-4549; Newark (302) 283-7130; Georgetown (302) 856-5495.
Have payment ready.

The Office of Vital Statistics does not take cash or credit cards for the application.

Make the personal check or money order out to Office of Vital Statistics.
Getting a Birth Certificate in Person Determine where to file your application.
There are three locations of the Office of Vital Statistics in Delaware where you can file your application for a birth certificate in person.
Determine which one is closest to you to get your birth certificate most quickly.
There are three locations so that you can choose one closest to you.

The three offices are located at: Jesse S. Cooper Building, 417 Federal Street, Dover, DE 19901; Chopin Building, 258 Chapman Road, Newark DE 19702; Thurman Adams State Service Center, 546 South Bedford Street, Georgetown, DE 19947.
File your application at the local Office of Vital Statistics.
Once you've determined the closest Office of Vital Statistics to you, take your documentation and payment and file the application.
All three offices are open Monday-Friday from 8:00am to 4:15pm, except state and federal holidays.
Wait for the copy of the birth certificate.
It can take a few days to a few weeks to get the copy of the birth certificate for which you applied.
If you have any questions about the process, you can contact one of the Offices of Vital Statistics at the phone numbers listed above.
Getting a Birth Certificate by Mail Compose a written request for a birth certificate.

The application is available online at http://dhss.delaware.gov/dph/ss/files/birth.pdf.
Send your application to the Office of Vital Statistics.
Once you've collected all of your required documentation, send your application to one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics.

Send your application to one of the three Offices of Vital Statistics at the following addresses: Jesse S. Cooper Building, 417 Federal Street, Dover, DE 19901; Chopin Building, 258 Chapman Road, Newark DE 19702; Thurman Adams State Service Center, 546 South Bedford Street, Georgetown, DE 19947.

If you have any questions about your application, follow up with of the Offices of Vital Statistics at the phone numbers listed above.

You can pay with Visa, Mastercard, American Express, or Discover.

VitalChek's website for Delaware birth certificates is https://www.vitalchek.com/birth-certificates/delaware/delaware-vital-records-georgetown.
You can file your application 24 hours a day, 7 days a week.
Follow online application prompts.

Follow these questions and any prompts for additional information or documentation until your application is complete and you receive a confirmation email.
If you have any questions about the process, you can access VitalChek's online FAQ page at https://vitalchek-solutions.custhelp.com/app/home or call their hotline at 1-877-888-0248.

At the end of filing your request online, the Vital Chek website will request your payment.

In addition, Vital Chek will charge you an additional fee for whatever shipping method you choose.
